body:
True, but what are the steps you took to get to this point?  

- What did you need to do to build the Vagrant environment this program runs in?
- What did you need to do to load the data in the "news" database?
- What directory does newsdata.py reside in?

When answering these questions, consider what the project specifications ask for: "Imagine a person who knows Python and SQL well, but has not done this project.  If that person read the README would they know how to run this code?"
As you say, there are several ways to solve this problem, and your approach is in fact a very good plan.
Per one of the project requirements, be sure to include the CREATE VIEW syntax in your README file for all of the views you use in your project.
